description: Plugin loads successfully with BentoBox and BSkyBlock
steps: Step 1: Start the Minecraft server with BentoBox and BSkyBlock installed
Step 2: Check server console for IslandSelector addon loading messages
Step 3: Verify no errors in console during startup
Step 4: Run /bentobox version and confirm IslandSelector is listed

description: Config.yml file is created with all default values
steps: Step 1: Start server with IslandSelector for the first time
Step 2: Navigate to plugins/IslandSelector/ directory
Step 3: Open config.yml file
Step 4: Verify all configuration sections exist (grid, slots, relocation, reserved, backups, gui, visitors, performance, integration, debug)

description: Database tables/collections are created on first startup
steps: Step 1: Start server with IslandSelector
Step 2: Check BentoBox database location (YAML/JSON files or SQL database)
Step 3: Verify IslandSelector data structures exist for grid locations
Step 4: Verify IslandSelector data structures exist for slot metadata

description: FastAsyncWorldEdit dependency is detected and verified
steps: Step 1: Install FAWE on the server
Step 2: Start server with IslandSelector
Step 3: Check console for FAWE detection message
Step 4: Verify no warnings about missing FAWE

description: Basic command /islandselector executes without errors
steps: Step 1: Join the Minecraft server as a player
Step 2: Execute /islandselector command
Step 3: Verify a GUI opens or appropriate message is shown
Step 4: Verify no errors in server console

description: Main grid GUI opens with 54 slots arranged correctly
steps: Step 1: Join the Minecraft server
Step 2: Execute /islandselector command
Step 3: Verify a chest GUI with 6 rows (54 slots) opens
Step 4: Check that top rows have scroll arrows and center area shows grid
Step 5: Check that bottom row has control buttons

description: Grid GUI title displays current viewport coordinates
steps: Step 1: Open the grid GUI with /islandselector
Step 2: Check the GUI title bar
Step 3: Verify it shows format like 'Island Grid Selector'
Step 4: Viewport info available in Grid Info button

description: Grid displays 7x4 island slots in center viewing area
steps: Step 1: Open the grid GUI
Step 2: Count the island display slots in the center area
Step 3: Verify there are 7 columns and 4 rows (28 total slots)
Step 4: Verify the slots are positioned in the center of the GUI

description: Available/empty locations display as green stained glass panes
steps: Step 1: Open the grid GUI on a fresh server with no islands
Step 2: Observe the grid display slots
Step 3: Verify empty locations show as GREEN_STAINED_GLASS_PANE items
Step 4: Hover over an empty slot and verify tooltip shows it's available

description: Occupied islands with online owners show player heads
steps: Step 1: Have a player create an island using BSkyBlock
Step 2: Ensure that player is online
Step 3: Open the grid GUI with a different account
Step 4: Locate the occupied island slot
Step 5: Verify it displays as the island owner's player head

description: Occupied islands with offline owners show player heads
steps: Step 1: Have a player create an island
Step 2: Have that player disconnect from the server
Step 3: Join with a different account and open the grid GUI
Step 4: Locate the offline player's island slot
Step 5: Verify it displays as player head (may show Steve if skin not cached)

description: Player's own island displays with enchantment glow effect
steps: Step 1: Create an island as a player
Step 2: Open the grid GUI
Step 3: Locate your own island in the grid
Step 4: Verify it has an enchantment glow effect
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows 'Your Island'

description: Reserved blocked locations show as gray stained glass pane
steps: Step 1: As admin, reserve a location with /islandselector admin reserve 0,0
Step 2: Do not set a price (leave it blocked)
Step 3: Open grid GUI as a player
Step 4: Locate position 0,0
Step 5: Verify it shows as GRAY_STAINED_GLASS_PANE with 'Reserved' tooltip

description: Reserved purchasable locations show as gold blocks
steps: Step 1: As admin, reserve a location and set price: /islandselector admin setprice 1,1 50000
Step 2: Open grid GUI as a player
Step 3: Locate position 1,1
Step 4: Verify it shows as GOLD_BLOCK
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows 'Premium Location' with price

description: Locked grid areas show as black stained glass pane
steps: Step 1: Configure grid with limited boundaries in config.yml
Step 2: Reload or restart server
Step 3: Open grid GUI
Step 4: Scroll to position beyond configured boundaries
Step 5: Verify locked areas show as BLACK_STAINED_GLASS_PANE with 'Locked Area' tooltip

description: Scroll up arrows move viewport north by 1 row
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click one of the scroll up arrow buttons
Step 3: Verify viewport moved up
Step 4: Verify grid content shifts appropriately

description: Scroll down arrows move viewport south by 1 row
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click one of the scroll down arrow buttons
Step 3: Verify viewport moved down
Step 4: Verify grid content shifts appropriately

description: Scroll left arrows move viewport west by 1 column
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click one of the scroll left arrow buttons
Step 3: Verify viewport moved left
Step 4: Verify grid content shifts appropriately

description: Scroll right arrows move viewport east by 1 column
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click one of the scroll right arrow buttons
Step 3: Verify viewport moved right
Step 4: Verify grid content shifts appropriately

description: Shift-clicking scroll arrows moves viewport by configured jump amount
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Shift-click a scroll arrow button
Step 3: Verify viewport jumps by 5 rows/columns instead of 1

description: Scroll arrows work at grid boundaries
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI at edge of grid
Step 2: Verify scrolling stops at boundaries
Step 3: Verify grid stays within configured limits

description: Filter All button displays correctly with paper item
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Locate bottom control row
Step 3: Find the 'Filter: All' button (should be PAPER item)
Step 4: Verify it has enchantment glow by default (active filter)
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows 'All' or similar

description: Filter Available button displays correctly with green dye
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Locate the 'Filter: Available' button (should be GREEN_DYE item)
Step 3: Verify tooltip explains it filters to available locations
Step 4: Verify it doesn't have glow initially (inactive)

description: Filter Online button displays correctly with lime dye
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Locate the 'Filter: Online' button (should be LIME_DYE item)
Step 3: Verify tooltip explains it filters to online players
Step 4: Verify it doesn't have glow initially (inactive)

description: Filter All shows all grid locations
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click 'Filter: All' button
Step 3: Verify grid shows occupied, empty, and reserved locations
Step 4: Verify the button gains enchantment glow (active filter)

description: Filter Available shows only claimable empty locations
steps: Step 1: Have some occupied and some empty islands in the grid
Step 2: Open grid GUI and click 'Filter: Available'
Step 3: Verify only green glass panes (empty locations) are visible
Step 4: Verify occupied and reserved locations are hidden or grayed out

description: Filter Online shows only islands with online owners
steps: Step 1: Have multiple islands, some owners online and some offline
Step 2: Open grid GUI and click 'Filter: Online'
Step 3: Verify only player heads (online owners) are shown
Step 4: Verify offline owners are hidden or grayed out

description: Search button displays with compass item
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Locate the search button in bottom row
Step 3: Verify it shows as COMPASS item
Step 4: Verify tooltip indicates it's for searching players

description: Search function finds player and centers grid on their island
steps: Step 1: Have a player named 'TestPlayer' with an island at location F10
Step 2: Open grid GUI as a different player
Step 3: Click the search button
Step 4: Enter 'TestPlayer' in the search interface
Step 5: Verify grid viewport centers on F10
Step 6: Verify TestPlayer's island is visible in the viewport

description: Search function handles partial name matching
steps: Step 1: Have a player named 'Notch' with an island
Step 2: Open grid GUI and use search
Step 3: Enter partial name like 'Not'
Step 4: Verify it finds 'Notch' and centers on their island

description: Search function shows error for player not found
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click search button
Step 3: Enter a player name that doesn't exist
Step 4: Verify an error message is shown indicating player not found

description: Find My Island button displays with ender eye item
steps: Step 1: Create an island as a player
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Locate 'Find My Island' button in bottom row
Step 4: Verify it shows as ENDER_EYE item
Step 5: Verify tooltip indicates it centers on your island

description: Find My Island button centers viewport on player's island
steps: Step 1: Create an island at a location
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Click 'Find My Island' button
Step 4: Verify viewport instantly centers on player's island
Step 5: Verify your island is visible in the center of the viewport

description: Find My Island button shows message for players without islands
steps: Step 1: Join server with a new player who has no island
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Click 'Find My Island' button
Step 4: Verify message indicates player has no island

description: Neighborhood View button displays with map item
steps: Step 1: Create an island
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Locate 'Neighborhood View' button
Step 4: Verify it shows as FILLED_MAP item
Step 5: Verify tooltip indicates it opens neighborhood view

description: Neighborhood View button opens 3x3 neighbor GUI
steps: Step 1: Create an island
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Click 'Neighborhood View' button
Step 4: Verify a new GUI opens showing 3x3 grid of neighbors
Step 5: Verify your island is in the center with glow effect

description: Slot Selection button displays with chest item
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Locate 'Slot Selection' button
Step 3: Verify it shows as CHEST item
Step 4: Verify tooltip indicates it opens slot management

description: Slot Selection button opens slot management GUI
steps: Step 1: Create an island
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Click 'Slot Selection' button
Step 4: Verify slot management GUI opens
Step 5: Verify it shows available slots

description: Close button displays with barrier item
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Locate close button in bottom row
Step 3: Verify it shows as BARRIER item
Step 4: Verify tooltip indicates it closes the GUI

description: Close button closes the grid GUI
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Click the close/barrier button
Step 3: Verify the GUI closes and player returns to normal view

description: Hovering over empty location shows available claim tooltip
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI
Step 2: Hover over a green glass pane (empty location)
Step 3: Verify tooltip shows world coordinates (e.g., 'Location: X: 1600, Z: -1600')
Step 4: Verify tooltip indicates it's available for claiming
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows 'Click to claim' or 'Click to relocate'

description: Hovering over occupied island shows owner information
steps: Step 1: Have a player with an island
Step 2: Open grid GUI as different player
Step 3: Hover over the occupied island slot
Step 4: Verify tooltip shows owner's name
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows world coordinates
Step 6: Verify tooltip shows online status (Online or Offline)

description: Hovering over own island shows Your Island indicator
steps: Step 1: Create an island
Step 2: Open grid GUI
Step 3: Hover over your own island slot
Step 4: Verify tooltip shows 'Your Island'
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows world coordinates

description: Hovering over premium location shows price and purchase option
steps: Step 1: Admin sets a premium location: /islandselector admin setprice D4 50000
Step 2: Open grid GUI as player
Step 3: Hover over D4 (gold block)
Step 4: Verify tooltip shows '⭐ Premium Location: D4'
Step 5: Verify tooltip shows 'Price: $50,000' or configured amount
Step 6: Verify tooltip shows 'Click to purchase'

description: New player without island sees grid in claiming mode
steps: Step 1: Join server with new player who has never created island
Step 2: Execute /island or BSkyBlock island creation command
Step 3: Verify IslandSelector intercepts and shows grid GUI instead of auto-creating island
Step 4: Verify available locations show 'Click to claim this location'

description: Clicking empty location in claiming mode opens claim confirmation
steps: Step 1: Open grid GUI as new player without island
Step 2: Click on an empty green glass location
Step 3: Verify a confirmation GUI opens
Step 4: Verify confirmation shows selected coordinates
Step 5: Verify confirmation shows neighboring island owners (if any)
Step 6: Verify confirmation has Confirm and Cancel buttons

description: Confirming claim creates island at correct grid coordinates
steps: Step 1: Select location C7 in claiming mode
Step 2: Click Confirm in confirmation GUI
Step 3: Verify BSkyBlock island creation flow starts
Step 4: After island is created, verify it exists at world coordinates matching C7
Step 5: Verify grid location C7 is now marked as occupied
Step 6: Verify player is teleported to new island

description: Canceling claim confirmation returns to grid GUI
steps: Step 1: Select an empty location for claiming
Step 2: Confirmation GUI opens
Step 3: Click Cancel button
Step 4: Verify player returns to grid GUI
Step 5: Verify no island was created

description: Grid coordinate A1 maps to correct world coordinates
steps: Step 1: Configure grid with origin x=0, z=0 and spacing=500
Step 2: Claim location A1
Step 3: After island creation, check island center location
Step 4: Verify world X coordinate is 0 (or origin X)
Step 5: Verify world Z coordinate is 0 (or origin Z)

description: Grid coordinate B2 maps to correct world coordinates
steps: Step 1: Configure grid with origin x=0, z=0 and spacing=500
Step 2: Claim location B2
Step 3: After island creation, check island center
Step 4: Verify world X coordinate is 500 (1 column * 500)
Step 5: Verify world Z coordinate is 500 (1 row * 500)

description: Grid spacing configuration affects island placement
steps: Step 1: Set island-spacing to 1000 in config.yml
Step 2: Restart server
Step 3: Claim location B1 (second column, first row)
Step 4: Verify island is created 1000 blocks from origin (not 500)
Step 5: Verify spacing matches configured value

description: Island UUID is linked to grid coordinates in database
steps: Step 1: Create an island at location D5
Step 2: Check database/storage
Step 3: Verify island UUID is stored
Step 4: Verify grid coordinate D5 is linked to that island UUID
Step 5: Verify this link persists after server restart

description: Cannot claim already occupied location
steps: Step 1: Have Player1 claim location E5
Step 2: Join as Player2 without an island
Step 3: Open grid GUI in claiming mode
Step 4: Try to click on E5 (occupied by Player1)
Step 5: Verify click is blocked or shows error message
Step 6: Verify Player2 cannot claim that location

description: Cannot claim reserved blocked location
steps: Step 1: Admin reserves location F6 without price (blocked)
Step 2: Join as player without island
Step 3: Try to click F6 in claiming mode
Step 4: Verify click is blocked with message indicating it's reserved

description: Can purchase and claim reserved premium location with sufficient funds
steps: Step 1: Admin sets premium location: /islandselector admin setprice G7 10000
Step 2: Give player 15000 money via Vault economy plugin
Step 3: Player clicks on G7 in claiming mode
Step 4: Verify purchase confirmation GUI opens showing price
Step 5: Click Confirm
Step 6: Verify 10000 is deducted from player balance
Step 7: Verify island is created at G7
Step 8: Verify G7 is no longer reserved

description: Cannot purchase premium location with insufficient funds
steps: Step 1: Admin sets premium location price to 50000
Step 2: Player has only 1000 money
Step 3: Player tries to purchase premium location
Step 4: Verify error message about insufficient funds
Step 5: Verify no money is deducted
Step 6: Verify location remains reserved

description: Purchase bypass permission allows claiming premium locations for free
steps: Step 1: Set premium location with price 50000
Step 2: Give player permission islandselector.bypass.cost.purchase
Step 3: Player has 0 money
Step 4: Player claims the premium location
Step 5: Verify island is created without charging money
Step 6: Verify player balance remains at 0

description: Slot Selection GUI opens with 27 slots and correct layout
steps: Step 1: Execute /islandselector slots or click Slot Selection button
Step 2: Verify a chest GUI with 3 rows (27 slots) opens
Step 3: Verify title is 'Your Island Slots'
Step 4: Verify slots 2-6 in first row show slot items
Step 5: Verify bottom row has Back and Close buttons

description: Active slot displays with enchantment glow and ACTIVE indicator
steps: Step 1: Create an island (becomes slot 1, active by default)
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Locate slot 1 display
Step 4: Verify it has enchantment glow effect
Step 5: Verify tooltip/lore contains '★ ACTIVE' indicator
Step 6: Verify name is green and bold (&a&l)

description: Inactive slot with island shows custom icon and switch prompt
steps: Step 1: Create islands in slot 1 and slot 2
Step 2: Ensure slot 1 is active
Step 3: Open slot selection GUI
Step 4: Locate slot 2 display (inactive)
Step 5: Verify it shows custom icon (default: grass block) without glow
Step 6: Verify lore shows island level and member count
Step 7: Verify lore shows 'Click to switch to this slot'

description: Empty unlocked slot displays with lime dye and create prompt
steps: Step 1: Player has 2 slots available but only 1 island
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Locate empty slot 2
Step 4: Verify it shows as LIME_DYE item
Step 5: Verify name is '&aEmpty Slot'
Step 6: Verify lore shows 'Click to create a new island'

description: Locked slot displays with barrier and unlock requirement
steps: Step 1: Player has permission for 2 slots but config allows up to 5
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Locate locked slot 3
Step 4: Verify it shows as BARRIER item
Step 5: Verify name is '&cLocked Slot'
Step 6: Verify lore shows required permission (e.g., 'islandselector.slots.3')
Step 7: Verify lore suggests how to unlock (e.g., 'VIP rank')

description: Player with islandselector.slots.2 permission has access to 2 slots
steps: Step 1: Give player permission islandselector.slots.2
Step 2: Remove higher slot permissions (slots.3, slots.4, slots.5)
Step 3: Open slot selection GUI
Step 4: Verify slots 1 and 2 are unlocked
Step 5: Verify slots 3-5 show as locked

description: Player with islandselector.slots.5 permission has access to 5 slots
steps: Step 1: Give player permission islandselector.slots.5
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Verify all 5 slots are unlocked (not showing barrier)
Step 4: Verify player can create islands in all 5 slots

description: Clicking locked slot shows error message about requirements
steps: Step 1: Player has only 2 slots unlocked
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Click on locked slot 3
Step 4: Verify error message is shown explaining unlock requirements
Step 5: Verify no action occurs (no switch, no island creation)

description: Clicking empty unlocked slot starts island creation flow
steps: Step 1: Player has 2 slots, with island in slot 1 only
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Click on empty slot 2 (lime dye)
Step 4: Verify BSkyBlock island creation/schematic selection starts
Step 5: After creation, verify new island exists in slot 2
Step 6: Verify both slots now show islands in slot GUI

description: New island in empty slot shares same grid location as other slots
steps: Step 1: Create island in slot 1 at grid location H8
Step 2: Create island in slot 2 (empty slot)
Step 3: Switch to slot 2 and check location
Step 4: Verify slot 2 island is also at grid location H8
Step 5: Verify both islands load at the exact same world coordinates

description: Clicking inactive slot opens switch confirmation GUI
steps: Step 1: Have islands in slot 1 (active) and slot 2 (inactive)
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Left-click on slot 2
Step 4: Verify a confirmation GUI opens
Step 5: Verify confirmation shows 'Switch from [Slot 1 name] to [Slot 2 name]'
Step 6: Verify confirmation has Confirm and Cancel buttons

description: Switch confirmation GUI shows current and target slot names
steps: Step 1: Rename slot 1 to 'Main Base' and slot 2 to 'Farm Island'
Step 2: Initiate switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 3: Verify confirmation GUI shows 'Main Base' → 'Farm Island'
Step 4: Verify format clearly indicates direction of switch

description: Switch confirmation shows cooldown warning if applicable
steps: Step 1: Set switch-cooldown to 3600 in config
Step 2: Switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 3: Immediately try to switch back to slot 1
Step 4: Verify confirmation GUI shows cooldown time remaining
Step 5: Verify warning about cooldown is displayed

description: Switch confirmation shows visitor teleportation warning
steps: Step 1: Initiate a slot switch
Step 2: Check confirmation GUI
Step 3: Verify warning message about visitors being teleported is shown
Step 4: Verify message explains where visitors will be sent

description: Confirming switch saves current island as schematic
steps: Step 1: Build structures on slot 1 island
Step 2: Switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 3: Confirm the switch
Step 4: Check file system at plugins/IslandSelector/slots/{uuid}/
Step 5: Verify slot-1.schem file exists
Step 6: Verify file contains the island data (non-zero size)

description: Slot switch clears current location in world
steps: Step 1: Have island with visible structures in slot 1
Step 2: Switch to slot 2
Step 3: After switch, check the grid location in world
Step 4: Verify old slot 1 structures are removed (void)
Step 5: Verify slot 2 island structures are now present

description: Slot switch loads target slot schematic at same location
steps: Step 1: Build unique structures in slot 1 and slot 2
Step 2: Switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 3: Verify slot 2 structures appear at the grid location
Step 4: Switch back to slot 1
Step 5: Verify slot 1 structures reappear exactly as they were

description: Slot switch teleports island owner to island spawn
steps: Step 1: Be on slot 1 island
Step 2: Switch to slot 2
Step 3: After switch completes, verify you are teleported to slot 2 island spawn point
Step 4: Verify location matches BSkyBlock's configured spawn for that island

description: Slot switch teleports team members to island spawn
steps: Step 1: Add a team member to your island
Step 2: Have team member stand on the island
Step 3: Island owner switches slots
Step 4: Verify team member is teleported to new slot's island spawn
Step 5: Verify team member remains on the team

description: Slot switch teleports visitors away from island
steps: Step 1: Have a visitor (non-team player) on your island
Step 2: Switch slots
Step 3: Verify visitor is teleported away (to their island or spawn)
Step 4: Verify visitor receives notification about being teleported
Step 5: Verify visitor is not on the island after switch

description: Visitors are teleported to their own island if they have one
steps: Step 1: Visitor has their own island
Step 2: Visitor is visiting your island
Step 3: You switch slots
Step 4: Verify visitor is teleported to their own island (not spawn)

description: Visitors without island are teleported to spawn
steps: Step 1: Visitor has no island
Step 2: Visitor is on your island
Step 3: You switch slots
Step 4: Verify visitor is teleported to server spawn point

description: Visitor teleportation includes configured delay for message reading
steps: Step 1: Set visitors.teleport-delay to 40 ticks in config
Step 2: Have visitor on island
Step 3: Switch slots
Step 4: Verify warning message is shown to visitor
Step 5: Verify visitor is teleported after 2 seconds (40 ticks), not immediately

description: Action bar shows progress during slot switch
steps: Step 1: Initiate slot switch
Step 2: Watch action bar during the switch process
Step 3: Verify messages appear like 'Saving current island...'
Step 4: Verify messages update to 'Clearing location...'
Step 5: Verify messages update to 'Loading new island...'
Step 6: Verify final message 'Switch complete!'

description: Player movement is restricted during slot switch
steps: Step 1: Initiate slot switch
Step 2: Try to move during the switch process
Step 3: Verify movement is blocked or player is held in place
Step 4: After switch completes, verify movement is restored

description: Switch completes successfully and shows completion notification
steps: Step 1: Switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 2: Wait for switch to complete
Step 3: Verify completion message is shown (chat or action bar)
Step 4: Verify sound effect plays (if configured)
Step 5: Verify you're now on slot 2 island

description: Canceling switch confirmation returns to slot selection GUI
steps: Step 1: Click inactive slot to open switch confirmation
Step 2: Click Cancel button
Step 3: Verify no switch occurs
Step 4: Verify player returns to slot selection GUI
Step 5: Verify still on original active slot

description: Slot switch cooldown is enforced correctly
steps: Step 1: Set switch-cooldown to 60 seconds in config
Step 2: Switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 3: Immediately try to switch back to slot 1
Step 4: Verify error message about cooldown
Step 5: Verify time remaining is shown (e.g., '59 seconds remaining')
Step 6: Wait 60 seconds and verify switch is now allowed

description: Slot switch cooldown persists across server restarts
steps: Step 1: Switch slots to trigger cooldown
Step 2: Restart server while cooldown is active
Step 3: Join back and try to switch again
Step 4: Verify cooldown is still enforced
Step 5: Verify remaining time is calculated correctly

description: Bypass cooldown permission allows switching without cooldown
steps: Step 1: Give player islandselector.bypass.cooldown.switch permission
Step 2: Switch from slot 1 to slot 2
Step 3: Immediately switch back to slot 1
Step 4: Verify no cooldown error
Step 5: Verify switch completes successfully

description: Setting switch-cooldown to 0 disables cooldown
steps: Step 1: Set switch-cooldown to 0 in config
Step 2: Reload or restart
Step 3: Switch between slots multiple times rapidly
Step 4: Verify no cooldown is enforced
Step 5: Verify all switches complete successfully

description: Right-clicking slot opens slot settings GUI
steps: Step 1: Have an island in slot 1
Step 2: Open slot selection GUI
Step 3: Right-click on slot 1
Step 4: Verify slot settings GUI opens
Step 5: Verify title shows 'Slot Settings: [Slot Name]'

description: Slot settings GUI displays current slot preview
steps: Step 1: Open slot settings for a slot
Step 2: Check slot 4 of the GUI (center of first row)
Step 3: Verify it shows the slot's current icon
Step 4: Verify it shows the slot's current name in tooltip

description: Slot settings GUI has Rename button with name tag
steps: Step 1: Open slot settings GUI
Step 2: Locate Rename button (slot 11)
Step 3: Verify it shows as NAME_TAG item
Step 4: Verify tooltip shows 'Rename Slot' and explains functionality

description: Slot settings GUI has Change Icon button with item frame
steps: Step 1: Open slot settings GUI
Step 2: Locate Change Icon button (slot 13)
Step 3: Verify it shows as ITEM_FRAME item
Step 4: Verify tooltip shows 'Change Icon' and explains to hold an item

description: Slot settings GUI has Delete Slot button with warning
steps: Step 1: Open slot settings GUI
Step 2: Locate Delete Slot button (slot 15)
Step 3: Verify it shows as TNT or LAVA_BUCKET
Step 4: Verify name is '&cDelete Slot'
Step 5: Verify lore includes '&c&lThis cannot be undone!' warning

description: Clicking Rename button allows changing slot name
steps: Step 1: Open slot settings for slot 1
Step 2: Click Rename button
Step 3: Enter new name via anvil GUI or chat (e.g., 'My Farm')
Step 4: Verify slot name changes to 'My Farm'
Step 5: Verify new name appears in slot selection GUI
Step 6: Verify new name persists after reopening GUI

description: Slot name changes are saved to database and persist across restarts
steps: Step 1: Rename slot 1 to 'Main Base'
Step 2: Restart server
Step 3: Open slot selection GUI
Step 4: Verify slot 1 still shows name 'Main Base'

description: Clicking Change Icon sets slot icon to held item
steps: Step 1: Hold a diamond pickaxe in hand
Step 2: Open slot settings for slot 1
Step 3: Click Change Icon button
Step 4: Verify success message
Step 5: Close and reopen slot selection GUI
Step 6: Verify slot 1 now displays diamond pickaxe as icon

description: Change Icon fails gracefully if no item held
steps: Step 1: Ensure hand is empty
Step 2: Open slot settings
Step 3: Click Change Icon button
Step 4: Verify error message explaining you must hold an item

description: Slot icon changes are saved and persist across restarts
steps: Step 1: Change slot 1 icon to emerald
Step 2: Restart server
Step 3: Open slot selection GUI
Step 4: Verify slot 1 still shows emerald icon

description: Clicking Delete Slot opens deletion confirmation
steps: Step 1: Open slot settings for a slot with island
Step 2: Click Delete Slot button
Step 3: Verify deletion confirmation GUI opens
Step 4: Verify confirmation shows slot name being deleted
Step 5: Verify strong warning about permanent deletion
Step 6: Verify Confirm and Cancel buttons

description: Confirming slot deletion removes island and frees slot
steps: Step 1: Have island in slot 2
Step 2: Delete slot 2 and confirm
Step 3: Verify slot 2 schematic file is deleted from disk
Step 4: Verify slot 2 metadata is removed from database
Step 5: Open slot selection GUI and verify slot 2 shows as empty (lime dye)
Step 6: Verify can create new island in slot 2 again

description: Deleting active slot switches to another available slot automatically
steps: Step 1: Have islands in slot 1 (active) and slot 2
Step 2: Delete slot 1 (the active one)
Step 3: Verify system automatically switches to slot 2
Step 4: Verify slot 2 island loads in the world
